title: 106_s585
content: The "Reconstructive Surgery Act of 1999" is cited as the short title. It covers reconstructive surgery in group health plans under Section 2706 of the Public Health Service Act. The "Reconstructive Surgery Act of 1999" requires group health plans to cover medically necessary surgery to correct abnormal body structures for functional improvement or normal appearance. The "Reconstructive Surgery Act of 1999" mandates group health plans to cover cosmetic surgery, defined as altering normal body structures for appearance improvement. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act and ERISA are made to include coverage for cosmetic surgery. Amendments to the Public Health Service Act and ERISA are made to include coverage for cosmetic surgery. SEC. 713 states coverage for reconstructive surgery. The "Reconstructive Surgery Act of 1999" requires group health plans to cover medically necessary surgery to correct abnormal body structures caused by various factors, aiming to improve function or restore a normal appearance. The "Reconstructive Surgery Act of 1999" mandates group health plans to cover cosmetic surgery, defined as altering normal body structures for appearance improvement. Amendments include referencing additional sections in the Act. The "Reconstructive Surgery Act of 1999" mandates group health plans to cover cosmetic surgery, with amendments adding references to sections 711 and 713. Section 2752 of the Public Health Service Act is amended to include coverage for reconstructive surgery in the individual market. The provisions of section 2706 apply to health insurance coverage in the individual market, effective for group health plans starting on or after January 1, 2000, and for health insurance coverage in the individual market on or after that date. For group health plans under collective bargaining agreements ratified before the enactment of the Act, the amendments do not apply to plan years starting before the termination of the last agreement or January 1, 2000. Plan amendments to comply with the Act do not count as agreement terminations. The Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act of 1996 is amended to coordinate regulations with the Employee Retirement Income Security Act of 1974 and the Public Health Service Act.
